overview.headline: Pregled
overview.table_description: Naslednja tabela vsebuje pregled štirih omenjenih meril. Tabelo lahko razvrstite tako, da kliknete na glave stolpcev. Upoštevajte, da lahko MQA interpretira samo informacije, ki jih zagotavljajo izvorni portali. Distribucije, URL za prenos in informacije o licenci niso obvezne, MQA pa manjkajoče informacije označi z minusom »-«. Upoštevajte tudi, da se lahko skladnost z DCAT-AP določi le, če izvorni portal zagotavlja svoje metapodatke v podatkih, povezanih z DCAT-AP. Druge oblike so označene z minusom »-«.

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the FAIR principles.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in GitLab. The vocabularies are derived from the EU Vocabularies.

interoperable.main_text: V naslednji tabeli so opisane metrike, s pomočjo katerih je določeno, ali distribucija šteje kot medobratovalna. V skladu z domnevo »enaka vsebina z različnimi distribucijami« je za preračunavanje točk uporabljena le distribucija z najvišjim številom točk. Največje število točk na tem področju je 110.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.
interoperable.keywords_desc_5: Preveri, ali je format distribucije strojno berljiv.
interoperable.keywords_desc_4: Preveri, ali je format distribucije nelastniški.
interoperable.keywords_desc_3: Preveri, ali vrsta formata in medija pripada nadzorovanemu slovarju.
interoperable.keywords_desc_2: V tem polju je opisana vrsta medija distribucije.
interoperable.keywords_desc_1: V tem polju je opisana oblika zapisa datoteke distribucije.
interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
interoperable.keywords_metric_5: The distribution is considered as machine-readable if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_4: The distribution is considered as non-proprietary if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_3:
The format vocabulary can be found in the data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link}.

The media type is check against the {link[https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml]}IANA list{link}

dimensions.main_text: V tem razdelku so opisane vse dimenzije, ki jih sistem MQA preveri za določanje kakovosti. Dimenzije so pridobljene iz načel FAIR.

scoring.main_text: Skupna ocena zbirke podatkov je seštevek točk iz vsake posamezne dimenzije.
scoring.text: Končna ocena je rezultat štirih skupin za ocenjevanje. Razvrščanje točk v določeno kategorijo ocenjevanja je prikazano v spodnji preglednici. Predstavitev ocene v orodju MQA je izražena izključno prek kategorij ocenjevanja. To ponudnikom omogoči, da lahko dosežejo najvišjo oceno, tudi z odbitkom nekaj točk.
scoring.headline: Ocena

methodology.headline: Metodologija za ocenjevanje kakovosti metapodatkov

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Česa ne pokrivamo

process.main_text:
Ob vsakem pobiranju so metapodatki preverjeni tudi v orodju MQA. Orodje MQA meri kakovost različnih kazalnikov, ki so pojasnjeni v spodnjih preglednicah. Rezultati preverjanj so shranjeni kot slovar kakovosti podatkov (DQV). Slovar kakovosti podatkov je specifikacija W3C, ki se uporablja za opis kakovosti zbirke podatkov.

Ker se dostopnost lahko spreminja, je treba redno izvajati preverjanja URL-ja za dostop in URL-ja za prenos. Iz tega razloga orodje MQA redno preverja dostopnost vseh distribucij. V primerjavi s preverjanjem drugih kazalnikov je pri tem čas izvajanja daljši, ker se distribucije preverjajo prek HTTP, vsak zahtevani URL pa ima lahko daljši odzivni čas. Orodje MQA ima mehanizem, ki upošteva dejstvo, da je v nekaj tednih po zadnjem pregledu treba ponovno preveriti dostopnost vsakega URL-ja.
process.headline: Postopek MQA

scope.main_text:
Z orodjem MQA želimo odgovoriti na naslednje vprašanje:
Kakšna je kakovost metapodatkov za podatke iz javnega sektorja v vseevropski regiji in katere so največje ovire pri doseganju boljše kakovosti?

Na osnovi tega se orodje MQA trenutno uporablja za preverjanje naslednjih konkretnih vprašanj:

  • Skladnost z aplikacijskim profilom DCAT in derivati aplikacijskega profila DCAT
  • Razkritje informacij, ki niso obvezne za aplikacijski profil DCAT
  • Dostopnost podatkov, na katere se sklicujejo metapodatki prek URL-ja za dostop in URL-ja za prenos
  • Strojna berljivost referenčnih podatkov
  • Uporaba licenc

Vsako vprašanje nato ponovno sproži individualne preiskave, ki so podrobno opisane v nadaljevanju.
scope.headline: Obseg raziskav

assumptions.main_text:
Zagotavljanje kakovosti metapodatkov (MQA) temelji na naslednjih domnevah.

Uporaba neobveznih polj

Verjamemo, da le izpolnjevanje obveznih polj aplikacijskega profila DCAT ne zadostuje za zagotavljanje visokokakovostnih metapodatkov. Zato so v oceni upoštevana tudi polja, ki v aplikacijskem profilu DCAT niso navedena kot obvezna. Polja, ki so preverjana, so navedena spodaj.

Enaka vsebina za več distribucij

Če zbirka podatkov vsebuje več kot eno distribucijo, je vsebina vsake distribucije enaka, razlikuje se le predstavitev podatkov. Zbirka podatkov ima lahko dve distribuciji, pri čemer so podatki v prvi v obliki PDF, podatki v drugi pa v strojno berljivi obliki RDF/XML.
assumptions.headline: Domneve

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

table_tooltip.known_licenses: Процентът на използваните известни лицензи. За повече информация относно известните лицензи, моля, вижте следните раздели. Тъй като лицензията не е задължителна, не може да се извърши проверка, ако липсва информация.

overview.headline: Преглед
overview.table_description: Следната таблица представя преглед на четирите споменати критерия. Можете да сортирате таблицата с щракване върху горните колонтитули. Моля обърнете внимание, че MQA обработва само информация, предоставена от порталите източници. Дистрибуциите, URL за изтегляне и информацията за лиценза не са задължителни и MQA обозначава липсваща информация с минус „-“. Обрънете внимание и на това, че съвместимостта с DCAT-AP може да се определи само ако порталът източник предоставя метаданните си в свързаните данни на DCAT-AP. Други формати се обозначават с минус „-“.

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

catalogue_detail.introduction: На тази страница е показано общото състояние на каталога по отношение на дистрибуциите и съвместимостта с DCAT-AP.

reuse.main_text: В таблицата по-долу са описани показателите, използвани за проверка на възможността за повторно използване на данните. В тази секция можете да имате максимум 75 точки.
reuse.keywords_metric_6: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
reuse.keywords_metric_5: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
reuse.keywords_metric_4: Проверява се дали се използва {link[https://publications.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-dataset/-/resource/dataset/access-right]}контролиран речник за права за достъп{link}.
reuse.keywords_metric_3: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the {link[https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/]}FAIR principles{link}.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab{link}. The vocabularies are derived from the {link[https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/authority-tables]}EU Vocabularies{link}.
reuse.keywords_metric_1: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
reuse.keywords_desc_6: Издател е лицето или организацията, публикували данните.
reuse.keywords_desc_5: Полето за звено за контакт съдържа информация за лицето за връзка при въпроси относно данните.
reuse.keywords_desc_4: Използването на контролиран речник увеличава възможността за повторно използване.
reuse.keywords_desc_3: В това поле се посочва дали достъпът до данните е обществен или ограничен.
reuse.keywords_desc_2: Ние бихме искали да ограничим наличието на неточна информация за лицензите. Така например често виждаме лицензи под CC, за които липса версия.
reuse.keywords_desc_1: Лицензът е ценна информация във връзка с повторното използване на данните.

contextual.main_text: В таблицата по-долу са показани някои свойства с ниско тегло, с които се предоставя повече контекст на потребителя. В тази секция можете да имате максимум 20 точки.
contextual.keywords_metric_4: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.

contextual.keywords_metric_2: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
contextual.keywords_metric_1: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
contextual.keywords_desc_4: Датата, на която са променени наборът от данни или дистрибуцията.
contextual.keywords_desc_3: Датата, на която са публикувани наборът от данни или дистрибуцията.
contextual.keywords_desc_2: Указва размера на файла в байтове.
contextual.keywords_desc_1: В някои случаи даден лиценз не може да бъде приложен за определен набор от данни. Полето „Права“ може да се използва за посочване на препратка към ресурс с информация относно правата, с които потребителят разполага при използване на набора от данни.

accessible.main_text: В таблицата по-долу е описано кои показатели се използват, за да се определи дали е гарантиран достъпът до дефинираните чрез дистрибуциите данни. В тази секция можете да имате максимум 100 точки.
accessible.keywords_desc_3: Ако съществува URL адрес за изтегляне, достъпността се проверява.
accessible.keywords_desc_2: URL адресът за изтегляне е директна връзка към въпросните данни.
accessible.keywords_desc_1: Не е задължително URL адресът за достъп да бъде пряка връзка към данните; той може да препраща към URL адрес, който дава достъп до набора от данни или до място, на което има повече информация за този набор.
accessible.keywords_metric_3: Посоченият URL адрес се проверява за достъпност чрез HTTP заявка по метода HEAD. Ако изведеният код на състоянието е в диапазона 200 или 300, достъпността на ресурса се оценява като положителна.
accessible.keywords_metric_2: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
accessible.keywords_metric_1: Посоченият URL адрес се проверява за достъпност чрез HTTP заявка по метода HEAD. Ако изведеният код на състоянието е в диапазона 200 или 300, достъпността на ресурса се оценява като положителна.

interoperable.main_text: В таблицата по-долу са описани показателите, които се използват, за да се определи дали дадена дистрибуция се смята за оперативно съвместима. Въз основа на предположението „еднакво съдържание с няколко дистрибуции“ при изчисление на точките се използва само дистрибуцията с най-високия брой точки. В тази секция можете да имате максимум 110 точки.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.
interoperable.keywords_desc_5: Извършва се проверка дали форматът на дистрибуцията е машинно четим.
interoperable.keywords_desc_4: Извършва се проверка дали форматът на дистрибуцията не е патентован.
interoperable.keywords_desc_3: Извършва се проверка за това дали форматът и типът медия фигурират в контролиран речник.
interoperable.keywords_desc_2: В това поле се посочва типът медия на дистрибуцията.
interoperable.keywords_desc_1: В това поле се посочва файловият формат на дистрибуцията.
interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
interoperable.keywords_metric_5: The distribution is considered as machine-readable if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_4: The distribution is considered as non-proprietary if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_3:
The format vocabulary can be found in the data.europa.eu GitLab repository.

The media type is check against the IANA list

findability.keywords_desc_3: Използването на пространствена информация дава възможност на потребителите да намерят набора от данни чрез филтрирано търсене на географски принцип.
findability.keywords_desc_2: Чрез категориите потребителите могат да разглеждат наборите от данни по теми.
findability.keywords_desc_1: Ключовите думи непосредствено подпомагат търсенето и така увеличават възможността за намиране на набора от данни.
findability.keywords_metric_4: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
findability.keywords_metric_3: Проверява се дали активът е набор или не.
findability.keywords_metric_2: Извършва се проверка дали за набора от данни са зададени една или повече категории. Броят на зададени категории не влияе на резултата.
findability.keywords_metric_1: Системата извършва проверка дали са зададени ключови думи. Броят на ключовите думи не влияе на резултата.
findability.main_text: В таблицата по-долу са описани показателите, чрез които хората и машините могат да намират набори от данни. В тази секция можете да имате максимум 100 точки.

dimensions.main_text: В този раздел са описани всички величини, които се проверяват чрез MQA за определяне на качеството. Величините се извличат от принципите на FAIR за научно управление на данни .

scoring.main_text: Общата оценка на даден набор от данни е резултат от сбора на точките за всяка величина.
scoring.text: Окончателната оценка се изчислява чрез четири групи оценки. В таблицата по-долу е показано как се нанасят точките към категорията за оценяване. Представянето на оценката в MQA става изключително чрез категориите за оценяване. Това дава възможност на доставчиците да получат най-високата оценка дори при известно отнемане на точки.
scoring.headline: Оценка

methodology.headline: Методология за оценка на качеството на метаданните

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Какво не обхващаме

process.main_text:
При всяко събиране на данни метаданните се проверяват и посредством инструмента MQA. Чрез MQA се измерва качеството на различните показатели, като всеки показател е разяснен в таблиците по-долу. Резултатите от проверките се съхраняват във вид на Речник за качеството на данните (DQV) (DQV). DQV е спецификация на W3C, която се използва за описание на качеството на наборите от данни.

Тъй като достъпността може да бъде променлива, е непроходимо да се извършват многократни проверки на URL адресите за достъп и изтегляне. Заради това MQA извършва периодични проверки на достъпността на всички дистрибуции. За разлика от проверката на останалите показатели, този процес е с по-продължително време на изпълнение, тъй като дистрибуциите се проверяват чрез HTTP заявки, като всеки заявен URL адрес може да има по-продължително време за отговор. MQA работи чрез механизъм, който отчита факта, че всеки URL адрес се проверява повторно във връзка с достъпността няколко седмици след последния преглед.
process.headline: Работа на MQA

scope.main_text:
С помощта на MQA се стремим да отговорим на следния въпрос:
Какво е качеството на метаданните в публичния сектор в общоевропейския регион и къде са най-големите препятствия пред постигането на по-добро качество?

Въз основа на това понастоящем чрез MQA се изследват следните специфични въпроси:

  • Съответствие с DCAT-AP и производните на DCAT-AP
  • Разкриване на информация, за която не е задължително DCAT-AP
  • Достъпност на данните, към които сочат метаданните, чрез URL адресите за достъп и изтегляне
  • Четимост на посочените данни от машини
  • Използване на лицензи

На свой ред всеки въпрос налага отделни проверки, които са описани подробно по-долу.
scope.headline: Обхват на изследването

assumptions.main_text:
Инструментът MQA работи въз основа на следните предположения.

Използване на незадължителни полета

Според нас попълването само на задължителните полета относно DCAT-AP не е достатъчно, за да се докаже високото качество на метаданните. Затова при оценката се проверяват и полетата, които не са задължителни съгласно DCAT-AP. Полетата, които се проверяват, са изброени по-долу.

Еднакво съдържание в няколко дистрибуции

Ако даден набор от данни съдържа повече от една дистрибуция, всички дистрибуции са с еднакво съдържание и се различават само по начина на представянето им. Така например за един набор от данни може да има две дистрибуции, като в едната данните са във вид на PDF файл, а в другата същите данни са в машинно четим файл във формат RDF или XML.
assumptions.headline: Предположения

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

overview.table_description: La tabella qui di seguito fornisce una panoramica dei quattro criteri di cui sopra. Si può suddividere la tabella cliccando sulle intestazioni delle colonne. Si noti che l'MQA è in grado di interpretare esclusivamente informazioni fornite dai portali sorgente. Le distribuzioni, l'URL di download e le informazioni riguardanti la licenza non sono obbligatori e l'MQA indica le informazioni mancanti con un meno "-". Inoltre la conformità alla specifica DCAT-AP può essere determinata solo se il portale sorgente fornisce i suoi metadati in dati DCAT-AP collegati. Gli altri formati sono indicati con un meno "-".

accessibility.headline: Distribuzioni disponibili
accessibility.description: I seguenti grafici forniscono informazioni sull'accessibilità delle distribuzioni. Per ogni URL di una distribuzione, viene effettuata una richiesta HTTP HEAD e viene controllata la risposta. Attenzione, l'URL di download è opzionale secondo il DCAT-AP e deve essere indicato in modo chiaro come tale dal portale sorgente. Questo potrebbe essere necessario solo per i portali sorgente che forniscono i loro metadati in DCAT-AP.

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the {link[https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/]}FAIR principles{link}.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab{link}. The vocabularies are derived from the {link[https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/authority-tables]}EU Vocabularies{link}.

accessible.main_text: La tabella seguente descrive le metriche utilizzate per determinare se l'accesso ai dati a cui si fa riferimento nelle distribuzioni è garantito. In quest'area è possibile raggiungere al massimo 100 punti.

accessible.keywords_metric_3: L'accessibilità dell'URL specificato è verificata tramite una richiesta HTTP HEAD. Se il codice di stato della risposta è nel range 200 o 300, l'accessibilità della risorsa è valutata positivamente.

interoperable.main_text: La tabella seguente descrive le metriche usate per determinare se una distribuzione sia da considerarsi interoperabile. Secondo il presupposto "contenuto identico con più distribuzioni", solo la distribuzione con il numero più alto di punti è usata per calcolare i punti. In quest'area è possibile raggiungere al massimo 110 punti.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.
interoperable.keywords_desc_5: Verifica se il formato della distribuzione è leggibile automaticamente.
interoperable.keywords_desc_4: Verifica se il formato della distribuzione è non-proprietario.
interoperable.keywords_desc_3: Verifica se il formato e il tipo di supporto appartengono a un vocabolario controllato.

interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
interoperable.keywords_metric_5: The distribution is considered as machine-readable if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_4: The distribution is considered as non-proprietary if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_3:
The format vocabulary can be found in the data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link}.

The media type is check against the {link[https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml]}IANA list{link}

findability.main_text: La tabella seguente descrive le metriche che permettono alle persone e alle macchine di trovare set di dati. In quest'area è possibile raggiungere al massimo 100 punti.

dimensions.main_text: Questa sezione descrive tutte le dimensioni esaminate dall'MQA per determinare la qualità. Le dimensioni sono derivate dai principi FAIR.

scoring.main_text: Il punteggio generale di un set di dati è dato dalla somma dei punti per ogni dimensione.
scoring.text: Il punteggio finale si basa su quattro gruppi di punteggi. La tabella seguente mostra la mappatura dei punti rispetto alla categoria di punteggio. La rappresentazione del punteggio MQA è espressa esclusivamente per mezzo delle relative categorie. In tal modo, i fornitori possono ottenere il punteggio più alto anche con una piccola deduzione di punti.
scoring.headline: Punteggio

methodology.headline: Metodologia di valutazione della qualità dei metadati

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Quello che non includiamo

process.main_text:
Con ogni raccolta, i metadati sono controllati anche dall'MQA. L'MQA misura la qualità di diversi indicatori, ciascuno dei quali è descritto nelle tabelle che seguono. I risultati delle verifiche sono conservati in forma di Vocabolario della qualità dei dati (DQV). DQV è una specifica del W3C usata per descrivere la qualità di un set di dati

Poiché l'accessibilità può essere volatile, sono necessari controlli ripetuti per gli URL di accesso e di download. Per questo motivo, l'MQA controlla periodicamente l'accessibilità di tutte le distribuzioni. Diversamente dalla verifica degli altri indicatori, questo ha un runtime più alto, poiché le distribuzioni sono controllate tramite HTTP e ogni URL richiesto può avere un tempo di risposta più lungo. L'MQA usa un meccanismo che tiene conto del fatto che l'accessibilità di ogni URL viene riesaminata alcune settimane dopo l'ultima verifica.
process.headline: Il Processo MQA

scope.main_text:
Con l'MQA, vogliamo rispondere alla seguente domanda:
Qual è la qualità dei metadati per i dati del settore pubblico nella regione pan-europea e quali sono i principali ostacoli per ottenere una qualità migliore?

In base a ciò, l'MQA sta attualmente esaminando le seguenti questioni concrete:

  • Conformità con DCAT-AP e relativi derivati
  • Divulgazione di informazioni non obbligatorie per la specifica DCAT-AP
  • Accessibilità dei dati a cui si fa riferimento nei metadati tramite l'URL di accesso e di download
  • Leggibilità automatica dei dati a cui si fa riferimento
  • Uso di licenze

Ogni questione porta a indagini specifiche, che sono descritte dettagliatamente qui di seguito.
scope.headline: Ambito della ricerca

assumptions.main_text:
L'MQA è basato sui seguenti presupposti.

Uso di campi non-obbligatori

Crediamo che compilare solo i campi obbligatori della specifica DCAT-AP non sia sufficiente per fornire metadati di alta qualità. Per questo motivo, la valutazione esamina anche campi che non sono specificati come obbligatori secondo la specifica DCAT-AP. Di seguito sono riportati i campi specifici verificati.

Contenuto identico per più distribuzioni

Se un set di dati contiene più di una distribuzione, tutte le distribuzioni sono identiche nel contenuto e differiscono esclusivamente nella rappresentazione dei dati. Ad esempio, un set di dati può avere due distribuzioni, una che offre i dati come PDF e l'altra che presenta gli stessi identici dati in formato RDF/XML leggibile automaticamente.
assumptions.headline: Presupposti

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

interoperable.main_text: It-tabella li ġejja tiddeskrivi l-metrika użata biex jiġi ddeterminat jekk distribuzzjoni titqiesx bħala interoperabbli. Skont is-suppożizzjoni "kontenut identiku b'aktar minn distribuzzjoni waħda", tintuża biss d-distribuzzjoni bl-akbar numru ta' punti biex jiġu kkalkulati l-punti. F'dan il-qasam jista' jingħata punteġġ massimu ta' 110 punt.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.

The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.

dimensions.main_text: Din it-taqsima tiddeskrivi d-dimensjonijiet kollha li l-MQA teżamina biex tiddetermina l-kwalità. Id-dimensjonijiet huma derivati mill-priniċipji FAIR .

scoring.main_text: Il-punteġġ ġenerali ta' sett ta' data jirriżulta miż-żieda tal-punti għal kull dimensjoni.
scoring.text: Il-klassifikazzjoni finali sseħħ permezz ta' erba' gruppi ta' klassifikazzjoni. L-immappjar tal-punti għall-kategorija tal-klassifikazzjoni jidher fit-tabella ta' hawn taħt. Ir-rappreżentazzjoni tal-klassifikazzjoni fl-MQA hija espressa esklussivament permezz tal-kategoriji tal-klassifikazzjoni. Dan jippermetti lill-fornituri jiksbu l-ogħla grad anki bi tnaqqis żgħir ta' punti.
scoring.headline: Klassifikazzjoni

methodology.headline: Metodoloġija tal-Valutazzjoni tal-Kwalità tal-Metadata

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Dak li ma nkoprux

process.main_text:
Ma' kull ġenerazzjoni, il-metadata tiġi vverfikata wkoll mill-MQA. L-MQA tkejjel il-kwalità tad-diversi indikaturi, kull indikatur huwa spjegat fit-tabella ta' hawn taħt. Ir-riżultati tal-verifiki huma maħżuna bħala Vokabolarju tal-Kwalità tad-Data (DQV). DQV huwa speċifikazzjoni tad-W3C li tintuża biex tiddeskrivi l-kwalità tas-sett tad-data.

Peress li l-aċċessibbiltà tista' tkun volatili, huma meħtieġa verifiki ripetuti għal accessURL u downloadURL. Għal din ir-raġuni, l-MQA tivverifika b'mod regolari l-aċċessibbiltà tad-distribuzzjonijiet kollha. B'kuntrast mal-verifika tal-indikaturi l-oħra kollha, din għandha perjodu ta' tħaddim itwal, peress li d-distribuzzjonijiet huma vverifikati permezz ta' HTTP u kull URL mitlub jaf ikollu ħin ta' rispons itwal. L-MQA tuża mekkaniżmu li jqis li kull URL huwa eżaminat mill-ġdid għal aċċessibbiltà fi żmien ftit ġimgħat mill-aħħar reviżjoni.
process.headline: Il-Proċess MQA

scope.main_text:
Bl-MQA, irridu nwieġbu l-mistoqsija li ġejja:
X'inhi l-kwalità tal-metadata għad-data tas-settur pubbliku fir-reġjun pan-Ewropew u fejn jinstabu l-ikbar ostakli biex tinkiseb kwalità aħjar?

Abbażi ta' dan, l-MQA bħalissa qed tinvestiga l-mistoqsijiet konkreti li ġejjin:

  • Tikkonforma mad-derivati DCAT-AP u DCAT-AP
  • Żvelar ta ' informazzjoni li għaliha d-DCAT-AP mhuwiex obbligat
  • Aċċessibbiltà tad-data msemmija fil-metadata permezz tal-URL ta' Aċċess u Tniżżil
  • Il-leġġibbiltà tal-magni tad-data li ssir referenza għaliha
  • Użu ta' liċenzji

Kull mistoqsija terġa' tirriżulta f'investigazzjonijiet individwali, li huma deskritti fid-dettall hawn taħt.
scope.headline: Kamp ta' applikazzjoni tar-riċerka

assumptions.main_text:
L-MQA hija bbażata fuq s-suppożizzjonijiet li ġejjin.

Użu ta' kampijiet mhux obbligatorji

Aħna nemmnu li l-mili ta' kampijiet obbligatorji DCAT-AP biss mhuwiex suffiċjenti biex tiġi pprovduta metadata ta' kwalità għolja. Għal din ir-raġuni, l-evalwazzjoni tivverifika wkoll il-kampijiet li mhumiex speċifikati bħala obbligatorji skont id-DCAT-AP. Il-kampijiet preċiżi li jiġu vverifikati huma elenkati hawn taħt.

Kontenut identiku għal aktar minn distribuzzjoni waħda

Jekk sett tad-data jinkludi aktar minn distribuzzjoni waħda, id-distribuzzjonijiet kollha huma l-istess bħala kontenut, l-unika differenza tagħhom tkun fir-rappreżentazzjoni tad-data. Pereżempju, sett tad-data jista' jkollu żewġ distribuzzjonijiet, waħda li toffri d-data bħala PDF u l-oħra li toffri d-data identika bħala RDF/XML li jista' jinqara minn magna.
assumptions.headline: Suppożizzjonijiet

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

overview.headline: Oversigt
overview.table_description: Følgende tabel giver et overblik over de fire nævnte kriterier. Du kan sortere i tabellen ved at klikke på spalteoverskrifterne. Bemærk, at MQA kun kan fortolke oplysninger, der leveres af kildeportalerne. Distributionerne, Download URL og licensoplysningerne er ikke obligatoriske, og MQA anfører manglende oplysninger med et minus "-". Bemæek også, at DCAT-AP-overholdelse kun kan bestemmes, hvis kildeportalen leverer sine metadata i DCAT-AP-forbundne data. Andre formater er angivet med et minus "-".

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

reuse.main_text: Følgende tabel beskriver, hvilke parametre der anvendes til at kontrollere genanvendeligheden af dataene. Der kan højst opnås 75 point i dette område.
reuse.keywords_metric_6: Det kontrolleres, om egenskaben er sat eller ej
reuse.keywords_metric_5: Det kontrolleres, om egenskaben er sat eller ej
reuse.keywords_metric_4: Det kontrolleres, om {link[https://publications.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-dataset/-/resource/dataset/access-right]}kontrollerede vokabular for adgangsrettigheder{link} er anvendt.
reuse.keywords_metric_3: Det undersøges, om egenskaben er sat eller ej.
reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the {link[https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/]}FAIR principles{link}.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab{link}. The vocabularies are derived from the {link[https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/authority-tables]}EU Vocabularies{link}.
reuse.keywords_metric_1: Det kontrolleres, om egenskaben er sat eller ej
reuse.keywords_desc_6: Udgiveren er en person eller organisation, der har offentliggjort dataene.
reuse.keywords_desc_5: Kontaktpunktet indeholder oplysninger om, hvem du skal henvende dig til, hvis du har spørgsmål til dataene.
reuse.keywords_desc_4: Brugen af et kontrolleret vokabular øger genanvendeligheden.
reuse.keywords_desc_3: Dette felt indikerer, hvorvidt adgangen til dataene er offentlig eller begrænset.
reuse.keywords_desc_2: Vi vil gerne begrænse angivelsen af forkerte licensoplysninger. F.eks. støder vi på mange CC-licenser, der mangler versionering.
reuse.keywords_desc_1: En licens er værdifuld information for genanvendelse af data.

findability.main_text: Følgende tabel beskriver de parametre, der hjælper mennesker og maskiner med at finde datasæt. Der kan højest opnås 100 point i dette område.

dimensions.main_text: Dette afsnit beskriver alle dimensioner, som MQA undersøger for at bestemme kvaliteten. Dimensionerne er afledt af FAIR- principper.

scoring.main_text: Den generelle bedømmelse for et datasæt opstår som følge af sammenlægningen af pointene for hver dimension.
scoring.text: Den endelige bedømmelse sker via fire bedømmelsesgrupper. Kortlægningen af point i forhold til bedømmelseskategorien udtrykkes udelukkende via bedømmelseskategorierne. Dette sætter leverandørerne i stand til opnå den højeste bedømmelse selv med et lille fradrag af point.
scoring.headline: Bedømmelse

methodology.headline: Metode for metadata-kvalitetsvurdering

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Hvad vi ikke dækker

process.main_text:
For hver datahøst kontrolleres metadatene også af MQA. MQA måler kvaliteten af forskellige indikatorer, og hver indikator forklares i tabellerne nedenfor. Resultaterne af kontrollerne gemmes som Data Quality Vocabulary (DQV). DQV er en specifikation af W3C, der anvendes til at beskrive kvaliteten af et datasæt.

Da tilgængeligheden kan være volatil, er det nødvendigt med gentagne kontroller af accessURL og downloadURL. Af denne grund kontrollerer MQA løbende tilgængeligheden af alle distributioner. I modsætning til verifikationen af de øvrige indikatorer, har denne en længere løbetid, idet distributionerne kontrolleres via HTTP, og hver anmodet URL kan have en længere responstid. MQA'en anvender en mekanisme, der tager højde for, at hver URL undersøges igen for tilgængelighed inden for nogle få uger fra seneste revision.
process.headline: MQA-processen

scope.main_text:
Formålet med MQA er at besvare følgende spørgsmål:
Hvad er metadatakvaliteten for data fra den offentlige sektor i hele det europæiske område, og hvor er de største forhindringer for opnåelsen af bedre kvalitet?

Baseret på dette undersøger MQA'en p.t. følgende konkrete spørgsmål:

  • Kompabilitet af DCAT-AP og afledte DCAT-AP
  • Oplysninger, som DCAT-AP ikke er forpligtet til at offentliggøre
  • Tilgængelighed af de data, der er omtalt i metadataene via Access- og Download-URL
  • Maskinlæsbarhed af de refererede data
  • Brug af licenser

Hvert spørgsmål munder igen ud i individuelle undersøgelser, som beskrives indgående nedenfor.
scope.headline: Omfang af undersøgelsen

assumptions.main_text:
MQA er baseret på følgende antagelser.

Brug af ikke-obligatoriske felter

Vi mener ikke, at udfyldning af DCAT-AP's obligatiriske felter alene er tilstrækkelig til at levere metadata af høj kvalitet. Af denne årsag kontrollerer evalueringen også felter, der ikke er specificeret som obligatoriske ifølge DCAT-AP. De præcise felter, der kontrolleres, er anført nedenfor.

Identisk indhold for flere distributioner

Hvis et datasæt indeholder mere end én distribution, er alle distributioner identiske i indhold, de adskiller sig kun med hensyn til fremstillingen af dataene. F.eks. kan et datasæt have to distributioner, én der tilbyder dataene som PDF og den anden, der tilbyder identiske data som maskinlæsbar RDF/XML.
assumptions.headline: Antagelser

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

overview.table_description: Seuraava taulukko antaa yleiskuvan mainituista neljästä kriteeristä. Voit lajitella taulukon tietoja napsauttamalla sarakkeen otsikkoja. Huomaa, että MQA voi tulkita vain lähdeportaalien tarjoamaa tietoa. Jakelut, latausverkko-osoite ja lisenssitiedot eivät ole pakollisia, ja MQA merkitsee puuttuvan tiedon miinus-merkillä "-". Huomaa myös, että DCAT-AP-yhteensopivuus voidaan määrittää vain, jos lähdeportaalin metatiedot ovat saatavilla DCAT-AP-linkitetyissä tiedoissa. Muut formaatit on merkitty miinus-merkillä "-".

reuse.main_text: Seuraavassa taulukossa on kuvattu, mitä mittareita käytetään datan uudelleenkäytettävyyden tarkistamiseen. Tällä alueella voi saada enintään 75 pistettä.

reuse.keywords_metric_3: Tarkistetaan, onko ominaisuus määritetty vai ei.
reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the {link[https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/]}FAIR principles{link}.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab{link}. The vocabularies are derived from the {link[https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/authority-tables]}EU Vocabularies{link}.

reuse.keywords_desc_1: Lisenssi on arvokasta tietoa datan uudelleenkäyttöä ajatellen.

accessible.keywords_desc_1: Verkko-osoite ei ole välttämättä suora linkki dataan, vaan se voi myös viitata verkko-osoitteeseen, jonka kautta tietoaineistoon pääsee tai jossa on siitä lisätietoja.
accessible.keywords_metric_3: Määritetyn verkko-osoitteen saavutettavuus tarkistetaan HTTP HEAD -pyynnöllä. Jos vastaukseksi saatu tilakoodi on 200- tai 300-alueella, resurssin saavutettavuus arvioidaan positiivisesti.
accessible.keywords_metric_2: Tarkistetaan, onko ominaisuus määritetty vai ei.
accessible.keywords_metric_1: Määritetyn verkko-osoitteen saavutettavuus tarkistetaan HTTP HEAD -pyynnöllä. Jos vastaukseksi saatu tilakoodi on 200- tai 300-alueella, resurssin saavutettavuus arvioidaan positiivisesti.

interoperable.main_text: Seuraavassa taulukossa on kuvattu mittareita, joilla määritellään, voidaanko jakelu katsoa yhteentoimivaksi. Sama sisältö, useita jakeluja -olettamuksen mukaisesti pisteiden laskennassa käytetään vain jakelua, jolla on suurin pistemäärä. Tällä alueella voi saada enintään 110 pistettä.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.
interoperable.keywords_desc_5: Tarkistaa, onko jakelun formaatti koneellisesti luettava.
interoperable.keywords_desc_4: Tarkistaa, onko jakelun formaatti ei-yksinoikeudellinen.
interoperable.keywords_desc_3: Tarkistaa, kuuluvatko formaatti ja mediatyyppi valvottuun sanastoon.
interoperable.keywords_desc_2: Tässä kentässä määritetään jakelun mediatyyppi.
interoperable.keywords_desc_1: Tässä kentässä määritetään jakelun tiedostomuoto.
interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
interoperable.keywords_metric_5: The distribution is considered as machine-readable if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_4: The distribution is considered as non-proprietary if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_3:
The format vocabulary can be found in the data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link}.

The media type is check against the {link[https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml]}IANA list{link}

dimensions.main_text: Tässä osiossa on kuvattu kaikkia dimensioita, joita metadatan laadunvarmistus tutkii laatua määritellessään. Dimensiot on johdettu FAIR-periaatteista.

scoring.main_text: Tietoaineiston yleinen pistemäärä on kustakin dimensiosta saatujen pisteiden yhteistulos.
scoring.text: Lopullinen luokitus tapahtuu neljän luokitusryhmän kautta. Pisteiden yhdistäminen luokitusluokkaan on esitetty alla olevassa taulukossa. Luokituksen edustus metadatan laadunvarmistuksessa ilmaistaan yksinomaan luokitusluokkien avulla. Näin datan tuottajat voivat saavuttaa korkeimman luokituksen, vaikka pisteitä hieman vähennettäisiin.

methodology.headline: Metadatan laadunvarmistusmetodologia

cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.headline: Mitä ei käsitellä

process.main_text:
Metadatan laadunvarmistus tarkistaa metadatan kunkin haravoinnin yhteydessä. Metadatan laadunvarmistus mittaa eri kriteerien laatua. Kriteerit on selostettu alla olevissa taulukoissa. Tarkistusten tulokset tallennetaan datan laatusanastona (DQV). DQV on W3C:n spesifikaatio, jota käytetään tietoaineiston laadun kuvailemiseen.

Saavutettavuus voi vaihdella, joten verkko- ja latausosoitteet on tarkistettava toistuvasti. Siksi metadatan laadunvarmistus tarkistaa kaikkien jakelujen saavutettavuuden säännöllisesti. Muiden kriteerien tarkistuksesta poiketen tämä tarkistus kestää kauemmin, sillä jakelut tarkistetaan HTTP:n kautta, ja kullakin pyydetyllä verkko-osoitteella voi olla pitempi vasteaika. Metadatan laadunvarmistuksen käyttämä mekanismi huomioi sen, että jokaisen verkko-osoitteen saavutettavuus tarkistetaan uudelleen muutaman viikon kuluessa edellisestä tarkistuksesta.
process.headline: Metadatan laadunvarmistusprosessi

scope.main_text:
Metadatan laadunvarmistuksen avulla halutaan vastata seuraavaan kysymykseen:
Mikä on metadatan laatu julkisen sektorin datalle yleiseurooppalaisella alueella ja mitkä ovat suurimmat esteet datan laadun parantamiselle?

Tämän perusteella metadatan laadunvarmistus tutkii seuraavia konkreettisia kysymyksiä:

  • Yhteensopivuus DCAT-AP:n ja DCAT-AP-johdannaisten kanssa
  • Sellaisten tietojen luovuttaminen, joille DCAT-AP ei ole pakollinen
  • Metadatassa viitatun datan saavutettavuus verkko- ja latausosoitteissa
  • Viitatun datan koneellinen luettavuus
  • Lisenssien käyttö

Jokaisesta kysymyksestä seuraa yksittäisiä tutkimuksia, joita on kuvattu tarkemmin jäljempänä.
scope.headline: Tutkimuksen laajuus

assumptions.main_text:
Metadatan laadunvarmistus perustuu seuraaviin olettamuksiin.

Ei-pakollisten kenttien käyttö

Uskomme, ettei pelkkä pakollisten DCAT-AP-kenttien käyttö riitä laadukkaan metadatan tarjoamiseen. Siksi arviointi tarkistaa myös kentät, joita ei ole määritetty pakollisiksi DCAT-AP:n mukaisesti. Tarkistettavat kentät on lueteltu alla.

Sama sisältö useissa jakeluissa

Jos tietoaineisto sisältää useamman kuin yhden jakelun, kaikki jakelut ovat sisällöltään samanlaisia ja eroavat vain datan esitystavan osalta. Tietoaineistolla voi olla esimerkiksi kaksi jakelua, joista toinen tarjoaa datan PDF-muodossa ja toinen saman datan koneellisesti luettavassa RDF/XML-muodossa.
assumptions.headline: Olettamukset

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

overview.table_description: La siguiente tabla ofrece una visión de conjunto de los cuatro criterios mencionados. Puede ordenar la tabla pulsando en los encabezados de las columnas. Tenga en cuenta que MQA solo puede interpretar la información proporcionada por los portales de origen. Facilitar las distribuciones, la URL de descarga y la información sobre la licencia no es obligatorio, y MQA indica la información ausente con un signo menos («-»). Asimismo, la compatibilidad con DCAT-AP solo puede comprobarse si el portal de origen proporciona sus metadatos en forma de datos vinculados según la especificación DCAT-AP. Para otros formatos, aparecerá «-».

accessibility.description: Los siguientes gráficos ofrecen información sobre la accesibilidad de las distribuciones. Para cada URL de una distribución se realiza una solicitud HTTP HEAD y se comprueba la respuesta. Tenga en cuenta que la URL de descarga es opcional, de acuerdo con DCAT-AP, y debe indicarse claramente como tal en el portal de origen. Esto puede aplicarse únicamente a los portales de origen que facilitan sus metadatos con arreglo a DCAT-AP.

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

reuse.main_text: La siguiente tabla recoge las métricas empleadas para comprobar la reusabilidad de los datos. La puntuación máxima en este área es de 75 puntos.
reuse.keywords_name_4: Vocabulario de las restricciones de acceso
reuse.keywords_metric_6: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
reuse.keywords_metric_5: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
reuse.keywords_metric_4: Se comprueba si se emplea el {link[https://publications.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/at-dataset/-/resource/dataset/access-right]}vocabulario controlado para los derechos de acceso{link}.
reuse.keywords_metric_3: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the {link[https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/]}FAIR principles{link}.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab{link}. The vocabularies are derived from the {link[https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/authority-tables]}EU Vocabularies{link}.
reuse.keywords_metric_1: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
reuse.keywords_desc_6: El editor es la persona u organización que ha publicado los datos.
reuse.keywords_desc_5: El punto de contacto contiene información de la persona a la que hay que dirigir cualquier pregunta relativa a los datos.
reuse.keywords_desc_4: El uso de un vocabulario controlado aumenta la usabilidad.
reuse.keywords_desc_3: Este campo indica si el acceso a los datos es público o, por el contrario, está restringido.
reuse.keywords_desc_2: Nuestra pretensión es limitar la provisión de información incorrecta sobre las licencias. Nos encontramos, por ejemplo, con muchos casos de licencias CC en las que no se indica la versión.
reuse.keywords_desc_1: Una licencia constituye información valiosa para la reutilización de los datos.

contextual.main_text: La siguiente tabla recoge algunas propiedades con poco peso que ofrecen más contexto al usuario. La puntuación máxima en esta área es de 20 puntos
contextual.keywords_metric_4: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
contextual.keywords_metric_3: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
contextual.keywords_metric_2: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
contextual.keywords_metric_1: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
contextual.keywords_desc_4: La fecha de la última modificación realizada en el conjunto de datos o la distribución
contextual.keywords_desc_3: La fecha en la que se publicó el conjunto de datos o la distribución.
contextual.keywords_desc_2: Especifica el tamaño del archivo en bytes.
contextual.keywords_desc_1: En algunos casos, no es posible aplicar una licencia específica a un conjunto de datos. El campo «Derechos» puede utilizarse para indicar una referencia a un recurso que informará al usuario sobre los derechos de los que dispone cuando utilice el conjunto de datos.

accessible.main_text: La siguiente tabla describe las métricas empleadas para determinar si se garantiza el acceso a los datos a los que hacen referencia las distribuciones. La puntuación máxima en este área es de 100 puntos.
accessible.keywords_desc_3: Si existe una URL de descarga, se comprueba la accesibilidad.
accessible.keywords_desc_2: La URL de descarga es un enlace directo a los datos referenciados.
accessible.keywords_desc_1: La URL de acceso no tiene por qué ser necesariamente un enlace directo a los datos; también puede tratarse de una URL que da acceso al conjunto de datos o que recoge información adicional sobre el conjunto de datos.
accessible.keywords_metric_3: Se comprueba la accesibilidad de la URL específica a través de una solicitud HTTP HEAD Si el código de estado de la respuesta se encuentra comprendido entre 200 y 300, el recurso supera la evaluación de accesibilidad.
accessible.keywords_metric_2: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
accessible.keywords_metric_1: Se comprueba la accesibilidad de la URL específica a través de una solicitud HTTP HEAD Si el código de estado de la respuesta se encuentra comprendido entre 200 y 300, el recurso supera la evaluación de accesibilidad.
accessible.keywords_name_3: Accesibilidad de la URL de descarga
accessible.keywords_name_1: Accesibilidad de la URL de acceso

interoperable.main_text: La siguiente tabla describe las métricas que se emplean para determinar si una distribución se considera interoperable. Partiendo de la asunción «contenido idéntico con varias distribuciones», solo la distribución con más puntos se empleará para calcular la puntuación. La puntuación máxima en este área es de 110 puntos.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.
interoperable.keywords_desc_5: Comprueba si el formato de la distribución es legible por máquina.
interoperable.keywords_desc_4: Comprueba si el formato de la distribución no está sujeto a derechos de autor.
interoperable.keywords_desc_3: Comprueba si el formato y el tipo de medio pertenecen a un vocabulario controlado.
interoperable.keywords_desc_2: Este campo indica el tipo de medio de la distribución.
interoperable.keywords_desc_1: Este campo indica el formato de archivo de la distribución.
interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
interoperable.keywords_metric_5: The distribution is considered as machine-readable if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_4: The distribution is considered as non-proprietary if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_3:
The format vocabulary can be found in the data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link}.

The media type is check against the {link[https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml]}IANA list{link}

interoperable.keywords_metric_1: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.

findability.keywords_desc_4: El uso de información temporal permite a los usuarios realizar una búsqueda acotada temporalmente.
findability.keywords_desc_3: El uso de información espacial permite a los usuarios hallar conjuntos de datos con una búsqueda acotada geográficamente.
findability.keywords_desc_2: Las categorías ayudan a los usuarios a explorar los conjuntos de datos atendiendo a su temática.
findability.keywords_desc_1: Las palabras clave ayudan de forma directa a la búsqueda y, por tanto, aumentan la facilidad de localización del conjunto de datos.
findability.keywords_metric_4: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
findability.keywords_metric_3: Se comprueba si se establece o no la propiedad.
findability.keywords_metric_2: Se comprueba si se asignan una o más categorías al conjunto de datos. El número de categorías asignadas no afecta a la puntuación.
findability.keywords_metric_1: El sistema comprueba si se han definido palabras clave. El número de palabras clave no afecta a la puntuación.
findability.main_text: La siguiente tabla recoge las métricas que ayudan a personas y máquinas a encontrar conjuntos de datos. La puntuación máxima en este área es de 100 puntos.

dimensions.main_text: Esta sección describe todas las dimensiones que contempla la herramienta MQA para determinar la calidad. Las dimensiones se derivan de los principios FAIR.

scoring.main_text: La puntuación total de un conjunto de datos se obtiene sumando los puntos de cada dimensión.
scoring.text: La puntuación final se calcula a partir de cuatro grupos de puntuación. En la siguiente tabla se muestra la asignación de los puntos a la categoría de puntuación. La representación de la puntuación en MQA se expresa exclusivamente a través de categorías de puntuación. Ello permite a los proveedores alcanzar la puntuación más elevada aunque se dé una ligera reducción de puntos.
scoring.headline: Calificación

methodology.headline: Metodología de evaluación de la calidad de los metadatos

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Lo que no contemplamos

process.main_text:
En cada proceso de recolección la herramienta MQA también comprueba los metadatos. MQA cuantifica la calidad con arreglo a varios indicadores, los cuales se explican en las siguientes tablas. Los resultados de estas comprobaciones se almacenan como Vocabulario de calidad de datos (DQV, Data Quality Vocabulary) . DQV es una especificación de W3C que sirve para describir la calidad de un conjunto de datos.

Dado que la accesibilidad puede ser volátil, es preciso llevar a cabo sucesivas comprobaciones de la URL de acceso y la URL de descarga. Por este motivo, MQA realiza comprobaciones periódicas de la accesibilidad de todas las distribuciones. A diferencia del resto de indicadores, esta operación tarda más en ejecutarse, dado que las distribuciones se comprueban a través de HTTP y el tiempo de respuesta de cada una de las URL solicitadas puede ser mayor. La herramienta MQA emplea un mecanismo que tiene en cuenta que la accesibilidad de cada URL se reevalúa pocas semanas después de la última comprobación.
process.headline: El proceso MQA

scope.main_text:
Con la herramienta MQA pretendemos dar respuesta a la siguiente pregunta:
¿Cuál es la calidad de los metadatos del sector público en la región paneuropea y dónde se hallan los principales escollos para mejorarla?

Partiendo de esta premisa, la herramienta MQA indaga actualmente en las siguientes cuestiones concretas:

  • Conformidad con DCAT-AP y los derivados de DCAT-AP
  • Divulgación de información no obligatoria para DCAT-AP
  • Accesibilidad de los datos referenciados en los metadatos a través de la URL de acceso y de descarga
  • Legibilidad por máquina de los datos referenciados
  • Uso de licencias

Cada cuestión da lugar a su vez a exámenes individuales que se describen en detalle a continuación.
scope.headline: Ámbito de la investigación

assumptions.main_text:
La herramienta MQA se basa en las siguientes asunciones.

Uso de campos no obligatorios

Consideramos que el hecho de rellenar todos los campos obligatorios de DCAT-AP no es suficiente para que los metadatos sean de alta calidad. Por consiguiente, en la evaluación también se comprueban los campos no obligatorios según DCAT-AP. A continuación se recogen los campos exactos que se comprueban.

Contenido idéntico para múltiples distribuciones

Si un conjunto de datos contiene más de una distribución, todas son idénticas en contenido, solo se diferencian en la representación de los datos. Un conjunto de datos puede contar con dos distribuciones, una que presente los datos como PDF y otra en la que idénticos datos se muestran en formato RDF/XML, legible por máquina.
assumptions.headline: Asunciones

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

overview.table_description: Tālākā tabula sniedz pārskatu ar četriem minētajiem kritērijiem. Tabulu var kategorizēt, klikšķinot uz kolonnu galvenēm. Lūdzu, ņemiet vērā, ka MQA spēj interpretēt tikai to informāciju, kuru sniedz avota portāli. Sadalījumu, lejupielādes URL un licenču informācija nav obligāta, un MQA uz iztrūkstošo informāciju norāda ar "-". Tāpat ņemiet vērā, ka DCAT-AP atbilstība var tikt noteikta, ja avota portāls sniedz savus metadatus ar DCAT-AP saistītiem datiem. Citi formāti tiek norādīti ar "-".

reuse.keywords_metric_2:
This section describes all dimensions that the MQA examines in order to determine the quality. The dimensions are derived from the {link[https://www.go-fair.org/fair-principles/]}FAIR principles{link}.

The MQA recommends and credits the usage of controlled vocabularies. The data.europa.eu portal publishes its controlled vocabularies in {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab{link}. The vocabularies are derived from the {link[https://op.europa.eu/en/web/eu-vocabularies/authority-tables]}EU Vocabularies{link}.

interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.

interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
interoperable.keywords_metric_5: The distribution is considered as machine-readable if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_4: The distribution is considered as non-proprietary if the specified format and media type is contained in the corresponding data.europa.eu {link[https://gitlab.com/european-data-portal/edp-vocabularies]}GitLab repository{link} vocabulary.
interoperable.keywords_metric_3:

The media type is check against the {link[https://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml]}IANA list{link}

dimensions.main_text: Šajā sadaļā aprakstītas visas dimensijas, ko MKN pārbauda, lai noteiktu kvalitāti. Dimensijas ir atvasinātas no FAIR principiem .

scoring.text: Galīgais vērtējums tiek noteikts, izmantojot četras vērtēšanas grupas. Punktu kartēšana vērtējuma kategorijā ir parādīta tālāk tabulā. Vērtējuma attēlojums MKN tiek izteikts, izmantojot tikai vērtējuma kategorijas. Tas ļauj sniedzējiem iegūt augstāko vērtējumu arī tad, ja nedaudz tiek atskaitīti punkti.
scoring.headline: Vērtējums

methodology.headline: Metadatu kvalitātes novērtējuma metodika

cover.main_text: The MQA is limited by the metadata it can examine. The investigation is limited exclusively to the metadata that data.europa.eu collects during the harvesting process. If there are errors in the source metadata, these can falsify the overall result. To limit this error potential, the MQA provides a validation service that can be used by data providers to validate their metadata for valid formats and compliant DCAT-AP before integrating it into the harvesting process.
cover.validator_ui: DCAT-AP SHACL validation service web page
cover.headline: Ko mēs neaptveram

process.main_text:
Līdz ar katru metadatu ievākšanas reizi tos pārbauda arī MKN. MKN mēra dažādu kritēriju kvalitāti; katrs kritērijs ir izskaidrots tālāk esošajās tabulās. Pārbaužu rezultāti tiek saglabāti kā datu kvalitātes vārdnīca . DKV ir globālā tīmekļa konsorcija specifikācija, ko izmanto datu kopas kvalitātes aprakstīšanai.

Tā kā pieejamība var būt mainīga, nepieciešamas piekļuves URL un lejupielādes URL atkārtotas pārbaudes. Šī iemesla dēļ MKN regulāri pārbauda sadalījumu pieejamību. Salīdzinot ar citu kritēriju verifikāciju, šim ir lielāks izpildlaiks, jo sadalījumi tiek pārbaudīti, izmantojot HTTP, un katram pieprasītajam URL var būt ilgāks atbildes laiks. MKN izmanto mehānismu, kas ņem vērā to, ka katra URL pieejamība tiek atkārtoti pārbaudīta pāris nedēļu laikā kopš pēdējās pārbaudes.
process.headline: MKN process

scope.main_text:
Izmantojot MKN, vēlamies atbildēt uz šādu jautājumu:
Kāda ir publiskā sektora datu metadatu kvalitāte Eiropas mērogā un kādi ir lielākie šķēršļi labākas kvalitātes iegūšanai?

Balstoties uz to, MKN šobrīd pēta šādus konkrētus jautājumus:

  • atbilstību DCAT-AP un DCAT-AP atvasinājumiem;
  • tādas informācijas atklāšanu, ko DCAT-AP nav pienākums izpaust;
  • metadatos norādīto datu pieejamību, izmantojot piekļuves un lejupielādes URL;
  • atsauces datu mašīnlasāmību;
  • licenču izmantošanu.

Katrs jautājums atkal noved pie individuālas izskatīšanas, kas plašāk aprakstīta tālāk.
scope.headline: Izpētes joma

assumptions.main_text:
MKN balstās uz tālāk norādītajiem pieņēmumiem.

Neobligāto lauku izmantošana

Uzskatām, ka tikai ar DCAT-AP obligāto lauku aizpildīšanu vien nav gana, lai nodrošinātu augstas kvalitātes metadatus. Šī iemesla dēļ novērtējumā tiek pārbaudīti arī tie lauki, kas saskaņā ar DCAT-AP nav apzīmēti kā obligāti. Visi lauki, kuri tiek pārbaudīti, norādīti tālāk.

Identisks saturs vairākiem sadalījumiem

Ja datu kopa satur vairāk par vienu sadalījumu, visi sadalījumi konteksta ziņā ir identiski, tie atšķiras tikai ar datu attēlojumu. Piemēram, datu kopai var būt divi sadalījumi, no kuriem viens piedāvā datus PDF formātā, bet otrs identiskus datus - mašīnlasāmā RDF/XML formātā.
assumptions.headline: Pieņēmumi

methodology.intro_text:
The Metadata Quality Assessment (MQA) is a tool developed by the consortium of data.europa.eu to study the quality of metadata harvested by data.europa.eu. It is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata quality and to receive suggestions for improvements. The results are presented via the MQA and are also available as download. In the following we describe the functionality of the MQA and the methodology it uses.

If this page still does not answer all your questions, please feel free to contact us via our feedback form at the end of the page.
methodology.sub_headline: How data.europa.eu measures the quality of harvested metadata

overview.table_description: Sljedeća tablica pruža pregled četiri navedena kriterija. Tablicu možete sortirati klikom na zaglavlje stupca. Imajte na umu da MQA može tumačiti samo informacije koje pružaju izvorni portali. Distribucije, URL za preuzimanje i informacije o licenciji nisu obvezne, a MQA informacije koje nedostaju označava minusom "-". Također imajte na umu da je sukladnost s DCAT-AP moguće odrediti samo ako izvorni portal pruža svoje metapodatke u  DCAT-AP povezanim podacima. Ostali su formati označeni minusom "-".

intro.desc:
The Metadata Quality Assurance is intended to help data providers and data portals to check their metadata against various indicators. For information on which metrics we use for indicator measurements, please have a look at our methodology page.

This page provides a general overview of all metadata available to data.europa.eu. For a detailed view of each individual catalogue, please use the Catalogues page and select the desired catalogue.

Prema pretpostavci „identični sadržaj s nekoliko distribucija”, samo se distribucija s najvećim brojem bodova upotrebljava za izračun bodova. U ovom je području moguće osvojiti najviše 110 bodova.
interoperable.keywords_desc_6: DCAT-AP compliance is calculated across all sources and datasets available on a catalogue. This check is only performed if the metadata is originally harvested as DCAT-AP or as a valid derivate.DCAT-AP is a specification for describing linked public data in Europe. The data.europa.eu portal may also harvest metadata which does not fully comply to DCAT-AP. In order to increase conformity to DCAT-AP, the MQA checks each metadata for its DCAT-AP compliance.

interoperable.keywords_desc_4: Provjerite je li format distribucije nezaštićen.

interoperable.keywords_metric_6:
The metadata is validated against a set of {link[https://joinup.ec.europa.eu/solution/dcat-application-profile-data-portals-europe/releases]}SHACL shapes{link}. The metadata is not compliant, if the SHACL validation reports at least one issue.

The MQA uses {link[/shacl]}data.europa.eu's DCAT-AP SHACL{link} validation service.

{link[https://www.w3.org/TR/shacl/]}SHACL{link} is a recommendation from the W3C and is used for validating RDF graphs against a set of shapes.
